thread.title: Game pockets cash among the pigeons
thread.title_full: Game pockets cash among the pigeons

title: Game pockets cash among the pigeons
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Game pockets cash among the pigeons Dave Bailey, co-founder of Mediatonic, is surprised by the success of a project that was intended to be a bit of fun Jack Hill/The Times Google+ 1 of 1 Dave Bailey, co-founder of Mediatonic, is surprised by the success of a project that was intended to be a bit of fun Jack Hill/The Times Analysis Case study Published at 12:01AM, September 1 2015 
In an industry where it is conventional for small Italian plumbers to battle turtle-like monsters, it can be tough for a video game to stand out as odd ( Josephine Moulds writes ). Hatoful Boyfriend , released by Mediatonic last year, did just that. 
It is a Japanese dating simulator, in which the central character is the only human in a school full of pigeons. She must romance her pigeon classmates, as she uncovers mysterious goings-on at the school. 
“It’s about pursuing the characters that interest you most,” Dave Bailey, a co-founder of Mediatonic, said. “Depending on whether you decide to take Subscribe now
